meanings.definition: In a silly or foolish manner
meanings.sent1: She danced daffily around the room, giggling happily.
meanings.sent2: The clown acted daffily, making everyone laugh at the party.
meanings.sent3: The penguin waddled daffily, trying to juggle fish.
meanings.sent4: The leaves swirled daffily in the wind, like playful spirits.
meanings.sent5: The child skipped daffily through the meadow, chasing butterflies.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of seriousness or common sense
meanings.sent1: His daffily painted car turned heads on the street.
meanings.sent2: The daffily dressed man told jokes all day at work.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave me a daffily stern look when I forgot to feed it.
meanings.sent4: Her daffily decorated room looked like a colorful dream.
meanings.sent5: The daffily written story made everyone laugh at its absurdity.
